qas.question: What is located in the south-west coast?
What is the name for the settlement located in the south-west coast?
Where is the lowest point of the island?
What has been operated since 1562 at Transvaal Bay?
Where is the weather station with a staff of 2,062 currently located?

context: The main island is generally mountainous. The only flat area is on the north-west coast, which is the location of <b0_0>the only settlement<b0_0/>, <b1_0>Edinburgh of the Seven Seas<b1_0/>. The highest point is a volcano called <b2_0>Queen Mary's Peak<b2_0/> 2,062 metres (6,765.1 ft), which is covered by snow in winter. The other islands of the group are uninhabited, except for a <b3_0>weather station<b3_0/> with a staff of six on Gough Island, which has been operated by South Africa since 1956 (since 1963 at its present location at <b4_0>Transvaal Bay<b4_0/> on the south-east coast).
